{"step_by_step_thinking": "The regeneration of the spinal cord is hindered due to several factors. Lack of endoneural tubes and growth factors, as well as the presence of a glial scar, are all factors that inhibit nerve regeneration. However, the lack of myelin inhibiting substance would not prevent regeneration. In fact, myelin inhibiting substances are known to inhibit nerve growth, so their absence would theoretically promote regeneration, not hinder it.", "answer_choice": "D"}
